title: Artichoke Hearts and Palm Hearts
ingredients: ca. 16 Artichoke hearts, preserved in can or jar
1 large can of palm hearts (palm sprouts), about 1 kg
½ tsp each salt and pepper
instructions: For the sauce, finely chop the hard-boiled eggs and parsley. Mix mustard, salt, pepper, grated onion, and vinegar, then gradually add the oil and beat the marinade with a whisk. Mix the eggs and parsley into the sauce.

Drain the artichoke hearts and palm hearts. Optionally, halve the artichokes. Cut the palm hearts into bite-sized pieces. Arrange the vegetables separately in bowls, drizzle with vinaigrette sauce, and let rest for 30 minutes before serving.
notes: Palm hearts also taste good with a sauce made from yogurt, mayonnaise, tomato ketchup, and spices.
suggested_wine: Sauvignon Blanc or an unoaked Chardonnay

title: Fish in a Crispy Crust
instructions: Wash and dry the fish fillets, marinate in lemon juice for 10 minutes, and season with salt and pepper.

Thaw the puff pastry and cut into 4 squares. Place a slice of Cheddar cheese between two pieces of fish, then wrap in the pastry squares, pressing the edges firmly. Brush the fish packets with beaten egg and bake in a preheated oven at 175°C for 40 minutes.
Garnish the fish with cucumber slices and diced tomato, and serve immediately.
notes: Serve the fish hot with remoulade sauce and white bread sticks.
